sections.title: Purpose
sections.content: Initial Purge of Condensate Skid: V-720, V-730, HE-735, V-740, E-742, V-745, V-750, V-785, H-080, V-730-130, HTR-750, E-735, E-751, V-750-110, V-750-115, ET-750-100, HE-750-140, V-774-100-200-300, P-782 and 783 and P-787 and 788. Purge gas used will be natural gas or nitrogen. If natural gas will be used, a suitable spot to source the system must be selected. Tie in natural gas or nitrogen at a low point drain between SDV-700 and PCV-705. The facility is based in Pennsylvania.

sections.content: Before starting the purge, confirm the pressure in the condensate treating area is at zero psig. Do not go above 125 psig. Due to the MAOP V-750, operator is unable to purge with pressures exceeding 125 psig.

Operator open (2) 3” ball valves on the outlet from V-750-110 to VRU-785 A and B. Operator open 2” outlet ball valve on V-750-110 to V-750-115. Operator open (2) 2” ball valves between V-750-115 and V-740. Operator open 1” ball valve on inlet and the outlet of LCV-750-115. Operator open (3) 3” ball valves on inlet and outlet of E-751. Operator open 3” ball valve on inlet and outlet of V-780. Operator close 3” bypass ball valve on V-780. Operator open 4” ball valve on V-780 to P-787 and P-788. Operator close 3” inlet ball valve of SDV-780. Operator to open 4” inlet ball valves to P-787 and P-788. Operator to open 3” outlet ball valves on P-787 and P-788. Operator to close 3” recycle valve from P-787 and P-788 to V-780. Operator to close 3” inlet ball valve to mole sieve dryer skid on outlet of P-787 and P-788. Operator open (3) 3” ball valves at Y connection to bypass mole sieve dryers. NOTE: Refer to mole sieve dryer purge procedure MS-SWP-0173. Operator place LCV-780 in hand at 0% from Scada. Operator open (2) 6” ball valves on the inlet to the measurement skid. Operator open 3” ball valve on inlet of V-720 and tank farm. Operator close 6” ball valve inlet of MarkWest measurement line. Operator close 6” bypass ball valve to MarkWest measurement line. Operator open 2” inlet ball valve to SDV-797. Operator open 2” choke valve on the outlet of PCV-797. Operator open 2” ball valve outlet of PCV-797. Operator places SDV-797 in hand 100% open from Scada. Operator places PCV-797 in hand 100% open from Scada. Operator open 2” inlet ball valve to SDV-798 Operator open 2” choke valve on the outlet of PCV-798. Operator close 2” ball valve outlet of PCV-798. Operator place SDV-798 in HAND 100% open from Scada. Operator place PCV-798 in HAND 100% open from Scada.

sections.title: Continuous Purging
sections.content: NOTE: If continuous purging is preferred or necessary, proceed with this section C. If step-up and stepdown purging is preferred or necessary, proceed with section D below. Slowly increase wet skid pressure to 100-120 psig by using low point drain between SDV-700 and PCV-705. Operator continue to check for leaks throughout the plant especially at the areas where piping may have been opened for maintenance. Operator should monitor gas detectors and fire eyes during this process. After pressure is verified to be 100-120 psig throughout the wet skid, operator will open (2) 1-½” gate valves on P-787 and P-788 to high pressure flare and leave open until any and all present oxygen has been purged from the system. Operator to maintain 100-120 psig during the continuous purge process by regulating purge gas at low point drain between SDV-700 and PCV-705. After all present oxygen has been purged from the wet skid, operator will close low point drain between SDV-700 and PCV-705. Operator to close (2) 1-½” gate valves on P-787 and P-788 to high pressure flare. NOTE: To verify that oxygen is completely purged, operator to crack high point vent and check for oxygen on all vessels.

sections.title: Step-Up and Stepdown Purging
sections.content: Slowly increase wet skid pressure to 50-120 psig by using low point drain between SDV-700 and PCV-705. After the gas pressure is verified to be 50 psig throughout the wet skid, operator to close low point drain between SDV-700 and PCV-705. Operator opens (2) 1-½” gate valves on P-787 and P-788 to high pressure flare. After pressure has been blow down, repeat all steps above for 100 psig purge test and 120 psig thereafter. NOTE: To verify that oxygen is completely purged, operator to crack high point vent and check for oxygen on all vessels.
requirements: Slowly increase wet skid pressure to 50-120 psig by using low point drain between SDV-700 and PCV-705.
Close low point drain between SDV-700 and PCV-705 after pressure is verified to be 50 psig.
Open (2) 1-½” gate valves on P-787 and P-788 to high pressure flare.
Repeat all steps above for 100 psig purge test and 120 psig thereafter.
Verify that oxygen is completely purged by cracking high point vent and checking for oxygen on all vessels.

relevant_clauses.text: The detection instrument shall be calibrated before use on each day of its use by the procedures specified in Method 21, 40 CFR part 60, appendix A.

The sponsor of any proposed construction or alteration covered by this part may revise his proposal at any time before or during the hearing. If he revises it, the presiding officer decides whether the revision affects the proposal to the extent that he should send it to the Administrator for a redetermination of the need for a hearing. If the presiding officer decides that it does not need to be resubmitted to the Administrator, he advises the parties of the revised proposal and takes the action necessary to allow all parties to effectively participate in the hearing on the revised proposal. Without limiting his discretion, the presiding officer may recess and reconvene the hearing, or hold another prehearing conference.

clause.title: Process Safety Information
clause.text: The intent of this paragraph is to provide complete and accurate information concerning the process which is essential for an effective process safety management program and for conducting process hazard analyses. Therefore in accordance with the schedule set forth in paragraph (e)(1) the employer is required to compile written process safety information on process chemicals, process technology, and process equipment before conducting any process hazard analysis.

recommendations.summary: To ensure full regulatory compliance, the SOP requires enhancements in calibration procedures, reference conditions, proposal revision processes, fire hazard precautions, and comprehensive process safety information. High-priority changes should focus on calibration and process safety information, while medium and low-priority changes address reference conditions, proposal revisions, and fire hazard precautions.

improvements.change: Incorporate a detailed calibration procedure for detection instruments as per Method 21, 40 CFR part 60, appendix A.
improvements.rationale: Ensures compliance with regulatory requirements for daily calibration, which is critical for accurate detection and measurement.
improvements.implementation_guidance: Develop a step-by-step calibration checklist and integrate it into the daily operational SOP for detection instruments.

improvements.change: Specify reference conditions for instruments as required by the standard.
improvements.rationale: Ensures that instruments are used under conditions that guarantee accurate and reliable measurements.
improvements.implementation_guidance: Consult the manufacturer's specifications and industry standards to define and document the reference conditions in the SOP.

improvements.change: Add detailed general requirements as per API 510 to the SOP.
improvements.rationale: Ensures comprehensive coverage of general requirements, enhancing the reliability and safety of operations.
improvements.implementation_guidance: Review API 510 Section 6.1 and incorporate all relevant general requirements into the SOP.

improvements.change: Develop a procedure for revising proposals and notifying parties as per the regulatory requirement.
improvements.rationale: Facilitates effective communication and participation in hearings, ensuring procedural compliance.
improvements.implementation_guidance: Create a flowchart or checklist outlining the steps for proposal revision and notification, and include it in the SOP.

improvements.change: Detail specific measures to reduce fire hazards related to equipment location and fume types.
improvements.rationale: Reduces the risk of fire hazards, ensuring safety and compliance with fire safety regulations.
improvements.implementation_guidance: Conduct a risk assessment to identify potential fire hazards and document preventive measures in the SOP.

improvements.change: Compile complete and accurate written process safety information on process chemicals, technology, and equipment.
improvements.rationale: Essential for effective process safety management and conducting process hazard analyses.
improvements.implementation_guidance: Establish a documentation protocol to gather and update process safety information regularly, and ensure it is accessible for hazard analysis.
